snippet: Philippe Dauman, the company’s chief executive, said that if Nickelodeon’s ratings had stayed steady last fall, total ad revenues would have been up.
abstract: Viacom says ratings slump at Nickelodeon contributed to lower profit in fourth-quarter 2011; earnings were $212 million, or 38 cents a share, down 65 percent from $610 million, or $1 a share, in year-ago quarter.
lead_paragraph: Philippe Dauman, the company’s chief executive, said that if Nickelodeon’s ratings had stayed steady last fall, total ad revenues would have been up.

headline.seo: Viacom Posts Lower Earnings, Blaming Ratings at Nickelodeon
headline.main: Viacom Earnings Fall; Nickelodeon Ratings Are Cited
headline.print_headline: Viacom Earnings Fall; Nickelodeon Ratings Are Cited
